Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a pale-red pottery grooved vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse and grey in section, the exterior is covered with a thin light-brown slip and remains of two lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394811) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394811)
